page.title: 05FARMING ON GRIBBEN HEAD
page.content: The remains of St. Catherine's Castle stand at St. Catherine's Point and the Gribbin Beacon marks the headland. {Gribbin Head-Farming ____________________ From St Catherine's Castle to Combe Hawne there are three grassland fields.One is a large barley field above the valley near Coombe Beach.All around the edge of the barley field it has been trampled down by walkers. From Coombe Beach down to Polridmouth there is a National Trust wood about 1 kilometre long. Following the path up from Polridmouth beach to the top of the woodland we came upon a field of potatoes half of which had been harvested.There were many smaller potatoes left lying on the ground. The walk to the Gribbin Head from the Menabilly carpark is about 1 kilometre
